transportAdvice: There is no public transit system on Saint Barthelemy, so renting a car or scooter is the most practical way to explore beyond Gustavia's compact, walkable town center. Taxis are available but limited in number, and walking is feasible within Gustavia itself.

weather.description: Dry and pleasant with cooling trade winds, making this one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Consistently sunny and dry with gentle breezes, ideal beach weather and peak season conditions.
Warm and largely dry with plenty of sunshine, still within the comfortable peak travel window.
Temperatures begin to rise slightly but conditions remain pleasant with low rainfall.
Warmth increases and occasional showers begin to appear as the wet season approaches.
Hot and humid with more frequent afternoon showers and the start of the quieter low season.
Warm and humid with periodic rain showers, though sunny spells are still common between storms.
Peak of the wet season with higher rainfall and the greatest risk of tropical storm activity.
The most active month for tropical weather systems; heavy rain and high humidity are typical.
Still within the hurricane season with frequent rain, though conditions begin to ease toward month's end.
Rainfall decreases noticeably and the island begins to transition back toward drier, more comfortable weather.
Dry and breezy with pleasant temperatures, marking the return of peak season and festive holiday visitors.
